page.title: 11Mining in the Past.
page.content: Mining in the past was poor. Conditions underground were appalling. The miners would have to crouch in the most awkward positions. Sometimes the shaft would flood, the miners would still go down with the water up to their waist. The tunnels would be pitch black with only the dim candle light lighting their way. The earliest machinery was the engine house but in the past the best machinery was their hands. The history of mining started of with pick axes and shovels. The miners used to go up ladders or up in a cage which is hoisted up by a wheel. The tunnel would be small, even a child would have to crouch underground. Outside of the mine the Cornish Stamps would be booming out. The ballmaids would probably go deaf. In the past they mistook fools gold for real Gold!
